events.message: The claimant reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at a traffic intersection, causing front-end damage.
Based on the initial report mentioning vehicle damage and accident details, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned promptly to handle the claimant's case and guide them through the process.
The claim was formally acknowledged and the claimant was notified that the case is now under review for further processing.
The claimant was asked to provide additional documents including the police accident report, vehicle repair estimate, and driver license copy.
All requested documents related to the accident and vehicle condition were submitted by the claimant within the stipulated deadline.
The claims investigation team initiated verification of submitted documents and third-party statements regarding the car collision accident.
The investigation was completed confirming the claimant's account and the extent of vehicle damage was verified for settlement calculation.
A settlement amount reflecting repair costs minus the deductible has been proposed to the claimant for approval or further discussion.
The claimant responded with gratitude for the prompt handling and agreed with the proposed settlement terms for the auto accident.
Following customer acceptance, the claim was officially approved and placed in the payment queue for prompt disbursement.
Payment for the approved claim related to the vehicle accident was successfully issued and the claimant was notified of transfer completion.
The auto accident claim has been closed after settlement payment, and the claimant received confirmation of closure and case resolution.
The final documentation of the claim was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference if needed.
